intro: Gonostemon rubiginosus, commonly known as the red-staining plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and distinctive reddish-brown staining on its stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America. Due to its unique appearance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
